page.title: 02ECOLOGY OF ELMLEY CASTLE
page.content: The area available to native flora and fauna is being restricted by land management,increased cultivation incentives pose threat to habitat. Chemical spraying,grubbing-out of scrubland (gorse,hawthorn,elder) and mature hedges (field maple,sloe, damson) deplete populations of heron,toad,hare,frog and owl.On the scree are local species of Carline thistle,Squinancy wort,thyme,chalk milkwort,purple milk vetch,hounds- tongue,field fleawort and cotton thistle.Mature woodland (beech,oak) and Forestry (Western Red Cedar) reveal fox,badger,grey sqirrel,roe deer,finches and crossbills.Shaggy inkcap,puffball fungi,and parasol mushrooms found.Light emerald moth, lesser horse shoe bat,slow worm and sparrow hawks.
